author: MVKozlov
body:
Tried to remote from Linux (Ubuntu 18.04) to windows (server 2016) and use Cyrillic letters
Get coredump

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS /home> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.2.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.2.1
OS                             Linux 4.15.0-43-generic #46-Ubuntu SMP Thu Dec 6 14:45:28 UTC 2018
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

PS /home> $s='фыва'
PS /home> Enter-PSSession  -ComputerName remote-windows.local -Credential $c -Authentication Negotiate

[remote-windows.local]: PS C:\Users> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14393.1944
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.14393.1944
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1


[remote-windows.local]: PS C:\Users> $s='фыва'
Failed to convert string with iconv, 7
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

# Expected behavior

```none
no fault
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Failed to convert string with iconv, 7
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

# Environment data
```none
packages installed for remoting:
  - krb5-multidev
  - libkrb5-dev
  - gss-ntlmssp
```

comments.author: MVKozlov
comments.body: Our Win16 servers does not have PSCore installed and installing additional software on these servers prohibited by our policy. Now I workaround this issue by `Copy-Item -ToSession` and running command remotely from these files instead of direct `Invoke-Command -File`

steps:
 - Install PS from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v6.2.1/PowerShell-6.2.1-win-x64.msi

- Connect to PS v6
- Get the same coredump ( where can I get it ? )
